definition: lit. to point at the mulberry tree and curse the locust tree/fig. to scold sb indirectly/to make oblique accusations (idiom)
finger/to point at or to/to indicate or refer to/to depend on/to count on/(of hair) to stand on end
old variant of 桑[sang1]
mulberry tree
surname Sang
to scold/to abuse/to curse/CL:通[tong4],頓|顿[dun4]
variant of 罵|骂[ma4]
Chinese scholar tree (Sophora japonica)/Japanese pagoda tree

sentences.english: He had been subject to a campaign of innuendo in the press.
sentences.chinese: 他一直受到新闻界指桑骂槐的影射。

sentences.english: As long as the one void of dust on the ceiling would rather destroy him.
sentences.chinese: 之尘只要一空虚了，就望着天花板指桑骂槐。
